dcterms:creator: Wouter Kool
Herke van Hoof
Max Welling
dcterms:description: The Traveling Salesman Problem (TSP) is a classic optimization problem where the goal is to find the shortest possible route that visits a set of cities and returns to the origin city.
dcterms:title: Traveling Salesman Problem (TSP)

dcterms:creator: Wouter Kool
Herke van Hoof
Max Welling
dcterms:description: The Capacitated Vehicle Routing Problem (CVRP) involves determining the optimal routes for a fleet of vehicles to deliver goods to a set of customers while respecting vehicle capacity constraints.
dcterms:title: Capacitated Vehicle Routing Problem (CVRP)

dcterms:creator: Irwan Bello
Hieu Pham
Quoc V. Le
Mohammad Norouzi
Samy Bengio
dcterms:description: The 0-1 Knapsack Problem (KP) is a combinatorial optimization problem where the goal is to select a subset of items with given weights and values to maximize total value without exceeding the weight capacity of the knapsack.
dcterms:title: 0-1 Knapsack Problem (KP)
